Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This position is responsible for supporting North American Maintenance & Engineering by creating, updating, and auditing internal manufacturing and external third party SAP master data, aligning with our internal and external standard business processes. Responsibilities include delivering trusted data accurately and efficiently; monitor, analyze, and continuously improve master data quality and effectiveness; ensure master data integrity is maintained though governance processes and procedures; and support new Product initiatives, as we strive to exceed our internal and external customer’s expectations.

At Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) the consumer is at the heart of everything we do. Join the team at KDP and make a difference to consumers with one of America’s leading producers and distributors of hot and cold beverages helping to satisfy every consumer’s beverage need, anytime and anywhere.













What you will do:













Setup new / update existing master data fields in SAP; including but not limited to Materials, BOM’s, Routings, Work Centers, Production Versions in a timely manner according to service level agreements, standard operating rules, and various supporting system applications (e.g., InterSpec, Teams, Sharepoint, etc.)
Audit, analyze and reconcile master data fields in SAP following Governance processes and procedures on a daily and periodic basis.
Investigate and resolve data incidents by collaborating internally and with business partners to identify root causes, implement corrective actions using the SC MD CAR (Corrective Action Request) process.
Identify data improvement opportunities and work collaboratively with peers and business partners to implement improvement initiatives.
Participate in decision making process to enable and optimize data governance processes and data quality monitoring processes.
Assist in creation and maintenance of training materials and work instructions to ensure information is current and effective for end users.
Maintain and promote an environment of team work and collaboration. Backup team members when/where required.
Maintain and update current Dashboards providing data analysis through Power BI.
Maintain weekly report of top three downtime offenders for the Plant, and assist in data collection efforts for improvement projects.
Follow all safety policies, procedures, and regulations.



















Characteristics for Success:







Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Effective critical thinking skills, and ability to analyze data to identify errors and root causes.
Strong collaboration and written / verbal communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Possess a good understanding of computer and industrial networks.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to effectively perform in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.



















Requirements:







2 years of experience to include master data processes & technology, data governance principles, or manufacturing process experience
Prior SAP or a similar ERP system experience
Experience creating, updating, and maintaining Microsoft Excel spreadsheets (including but not limited to VLookUps, Pivot Tables, Charts, etc)


































Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a leading beverage company in North America, with a portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partners brands and powerful distribution capabilities to provide a beverage for every need, anytime, anywhere. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!

Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?

We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~28,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.

Keurig Dr Pepper is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. Keurig Dr Pepper recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability or association with a person with a disability, medical condition, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Astek Group




Founded in France in 1988, Astek is a global player in engineering and technology consulting. With its expertise in various industrial and tertiary sectors, Astek supports its international clients in the intelligent deployment of their products and services, as well as in the implementation of their digital transformation.




Since its inception, the Group has based its development on a strong culture of entrepreneurship and innovation, and on the support and upskilling of its 7800 employees who are committed every day to promoting the complementarity between digital technologies and complex system engineering.




In Canada, the firm specializes in IT consulting services and engineering. Our teams successfully drive our clients' development strategies. Around common values, we have gained their trust and address their business challenges by putting their needs at the center of our actions and priorities.




This ecosystem of expertise enables Astek Canada to adapt quickly to evolving technologies, and all employees participate collaboratively in their development.




Are you ready to take on a new challenge, give your career a boost, and participate in innovative and stimulating projects?




Join a rapidly growing Group in Canada and worldwide that achieved a turnover of €600 million in 2023.










Your mission would be:




• Work with SMEs to automate daily PnL processes related to FX Options and Global Metals business.

• Build end to end reconciliations as directed by SMEs within the team – Book of Record to PnL Reporting Tool to General Ledger.

• Data profiling to prove out and challenge detailed requirements – identifying outliers or missed requirements.

• Build visualizations in Power BI for Senior Executives.

• Attend daily project meetings.







Your profile:




• Automation ( Small technology ) experience = 2 years.

• Power BI / Python / Alteryx / UiPath knowledge = 2 years.

• Capital Markets experience = 1-2 years.

• Accounting experience (a plus).







Let's meet!

Do you like our common project?

Apply here and join our team!







Our Advantages

• A tailored CARE policy deployed by our HR teams for our employees.

• Our Diversity Charter.

• Activities among colleagues such as Teambuilding or Happy Hours.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Austin, TX (Hybrid - On-site 2 days per week)

Video

No H1

This role requires candidates to be local to Austin, as it involves a hybrid work arrangement with two days per week on-site.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data entry, maintenance, and analysis, with experience in working with databases. The primary focus of this role is to assist with the maintenance of roadway data, utilizing an in-house spatial database and custom user interfaces. The role will also involve regular communication and coordination with governmental agencies and other agency staff.

Key Responsibilities


Data Maintenance: Update and maintain roadway attribute data within the TxDOT custom spatial database, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Process Adherence: Follow documented workflows, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and best practices to deliver high-quality data with minimal errors.
Coordination: Work closely with District staff and other agency personnel to assist in the maintenance and updating of roadway data.
Data Analysis: Review, analyze, and summarize relevant documents to support data integrity and accuracy.
Content Development: Assist in developing and maintaining content for internal SharePoint wiki pages, contributing to knowledge sharing and documentation efforts.
Collaboration: Utilize the Microsoft Product Suite, including SharePoint and Microsoft Teams, to coordinate tasks and manage projects effectively.
Additional Tasks: Perform related work as assigned, contributing to various data-driven projects and initiatives.


Qualifications


Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university, preferably in Data Science, GIS, Computer Science, or a related field. Relevant experience may be substituted for educational qualifications.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in data analysis, data maintenance, and data entry tasks.
Experience with SQL and familiarity with the Oracle environment.
Experience with Linear Referencing Systems (LRS) and related analysis.
Knowledge of geospatial concepts, data, and platforms/software, including ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online, and Esri Portal.
Experience with FME (Feature Manipulation Engine) and/or Python scripting.
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with governmental agencies and coordinate with internal staff.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About LastPass

LastPass is a leader in password and identity management, making it easier to log into life and work. Trusted by 100,000 businesses and millions of users, LastPass combines advanced security with effortless access for individuals, families, small business owners, and enterprise professionals. With LastPass, important credentials are protected and private – and always within reach.

We welcome new ideas, support your growth, and recognize your value, if this aligns with what you are looking for in your next career move, Join Us!

LastPass is looking for a Marketing Data Analyst:

LastPass seeks a Marketing Data Analyst to enhance our data and reporting capabilities, refine strategies, and boost efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate with the Marketing Analytics team to develop data assets, reports, and visualizations, providing actionable insights for various execution teams. You will also work closely with Digital Acquisition, Demand Generation, Finance, and Sales teams to create innovative solutions using advanced data environments.

If you are passionate about complex problem solving and motivated by scale, then this is the role for you!

Who will you work with?

In addition to collaborating with the Marketing Analytics team, you will work with the Digital, Demand Generation, Finance, and Sales teams as key stakeholders. You will also receive support from robust Systems and Data teams to drive progress towards organizational and functional goals.

What are some of the exciting challenges you will be working on?


Gather and compile data from diverse sources with precision.
Standardize analytics delivery for recurring assets and conduct ad-hoc analyses for performance and optimization.
Create informative charts, graphs, and dashboards using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Excel.
Enhance and maintain communication materials for QBRs, BOD discussions, and all-hands meetings.
Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and stakeholders to meet data requirements and deliver insights.
Continuously update your knowledge in data analytics and stay informed about best practices.


What does it take to work at LastPass?


Experience in data interpretation and modeling, with a bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, including Excel, SQL, Python, or R.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights.
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking.
Highly organized, capable of managing multiple tasks and deadlines.
Collaborative team player with a diverse and inclusive mindset.
Willingness to learn and adapt to new tools and techniques in data analysis.


Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $73,000 in the lowest geographic market and up to $86,250 per year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on several factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Why LastPass?


Market-leading password manager
High-growth, collaborative environment with inclusive teams
Remote first culture
Competitive compensation
Flexible Paid time off policies including but not limited to: Monthly self-care days (12 extra paid days off annually), volunteering days
Generous Parental leave
Comprehensive health coverage, dependents included
Home office setup support
LastPass families free account up to 5 members
Continuous learning and development opportunities


Unlock your potential with us - your skills, experience, and unique perspective matter more than just checking the boxes. Apply today, and let's build the future together!

We’re building an inclusive community that reflects the people of all races, genders, sexual orientations, national origins, backgrounds, and perspectives who share our world.

For all US based jobs please review our Applicant Privacy Notice

For all EU based jobs please review our Candidate Privacy Notice

Please review our CCPA Notice

  • Flexible Paid time off policies including but not limited to: Monthly self-care days (12 extra paid days off annually), volunteering days
  • Generous Parental leave
  • Comprehensive health coverage, dependents included
  • Home office setup support
  • LastPass families free account up to 5 members
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities

Unlock your potential with us - your skills, experience, and unique perspective matter more than just checking the boxes. Apply today, and let's build the future together!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Docker is a remote first company with employees across Europe, APAC and the Americas that simplifies the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. We raised our Series C funding in March 2022 for $105M at a $2.1B valuation. We continued to see exponential revenue growth last year. Join us for a whale of a ride!

We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our Product - Data & Growth team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and transforming data from various sources, developing and maintaining data models, and creating insightful reports and dashboards that drive business decisions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and provide actionable insights that support key initiatives across the organization.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is passionate about data, enjoys problem-solving, and is eager to contribute to a growing data team. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with senior analysts and engineers, learning from them while also contributing to Docker’s data-driven culture.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Analysis and Transformation: Analyze and transform data using tools like Snowflake and DBT, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data across various sources.
Data Modeling: Assist in the development and maintenance of data models that support both ongoing and ad-hoc analysis, enabling the team to make informed decisions.
Reporting and Dashboarding: Create and manage comprehensive dashboards and reports using Looker, providing clear and actionable insights to stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with senior analysts, data engineers, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and contribute to data solutions that address business needs.
Data Quality: Help maintain high standards of data quality by identifying and addressing data inconsistencies and errors.
Documentation: Contribute to the development of user-facing documentation for key data processes, metrics, and models to support the data-driven culture within Docker.


Key Skills and Qualifications:


Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a proven ability to work in fast-paced, cross-functional environments.
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data warehousing concepts. Experience with tools like Snowflake, DBT, and Looker is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to data analysis, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
Learning Mindset: A self-starter with a passion for continuous learning and improvement, eager to grow within the data team.


What to expect in the first 30 days:


Get to know Docker! Familiarize yourself with our vision, mission, values, and product
Complete all required onboarding and training sessions.
Gain access to necessary systems, databases, and platforms.
Shadow team members to learn about our development workflows and key data assets.
Begin working on initial data analysis tasks, focusing on understanding existing data models and reports.


What to expect in the first 90 days:


Achieve a solid understanding of key data models, dashboards, and reporting structures.
Take ownership of smaller data analysis projects, contributing to the development and maintenance of data models and reports.
Collaborate with senior analysts on more complex tasks, learning best practices and advanced techniques.
Contribute to the improvement of data quality by identifying and resolving inconsistencies in datasets.
Begin creating documentation for key data processes and metrics, supporting the team’s data-driven initiatives.


What to expect in the first year:


Take on larger, more complex data analysis projects, driving them from inception to completion.
Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports that provide valuable insights to stakeholders.
Continuously improve data models and reporting processes, ensuring they meet the evolving needs of the business.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions that support key business initiatives.
Establish yourself as a key contributor to the data team, actively participating in the growth and success of Docker’s data-driven culture.

Please see the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here.

Please see the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here.

Perks (for Full Time Employees)


Freedom & flexibility; fit your work around your life
Home office setup; we want you comfortable while you work
16 weeks of paid Parental leave
Technology stipend equivalent to $100 net/month
PTO plan that encourages you to take time to do the things you enjoy
Quarterly, company-wide hackathons
Training stipend for conferences, courses and classes
Equity; we are a growing start-up and want all employees to have a share in the success of the company
Docker Swag
Medical benefits, retirement and holidays vary by country


Docker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

Title: Junior Data Analyst with Power Bi (Local to CA) - W2
Description:
Candidate will have a strong background in designing and developing Power BI reports, as well as expertise in SQL, data modeling, and the Power BI tool stack. You will play a critical role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that drive business decisions.

Key Responsibilities

Power BI Report Design:

Design and develop advanced Power BI reports and dashboards that are visually compelling and easy to understand.

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure that reports meet business needs.

Optimize report performance and ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Data Modeling

Build and maintain complex data models to support analytical needs.

Work with large datasets, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.

Design and implement data architecture to enable efficient data flow and transformation.

DAX And Power BI Tool Stack Expertise

Write complex DAX formulas to support custom calculations and metrics in Power BI.

Use Power Query to clean, transform, and load data into Power BI.

Utilize tools like DAX Studio and Tabular Editor to enhance Power BI models and optimize performance.

SQL Development

Write and optimize SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.

Collaborate with database administrators to ensure efficient database design and query performance.

Collaboration And Communication

Work closely with business analysts, data engineers, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.

Provide training and support to end-users to maximize the adoption and effectiveness of Power BI reports.

Qualifications

Experience:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in Power BI development.

Proven expertise in designing and developing complex Power BI reports and dashboards.

Extensive experience in data modeling, SQL, DAX, and the Power BI tool stack.

Technical Skills

Expert-level proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, DAX Studio, and Tabular Editor.

Strong SQL Development Skills, Including Experience With Large-scale Databases.

In-depth understanding of data warehousing concepts and best practices.

Soft Skills

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

Skills: power bi,power query,sql,dax,sql development,data modeling

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Contract - 6 Months, Hybrid)

Location: Downtown Toronto, Hybrid

Position Overview: We are seeking a Junior Data Analyst for a 6-month contract with a strong potential for extension. This role involves a blend of data entry, analysis, and communication, supporting the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) in compliance with FINTRAC regulations. The ideal candidate will possess a Canadian university degree and demonstrate a high level of organization and analytical skills.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Management and Analysis:
Input and manage reportable data related to FIU investigations.
Prepare and compile detailed transaction reports for FIU teams.
Ensure accuracy in documentation and data handling in compliance with FINTRAC regulations.
Workflow and Documentation:
Operate within established workflows, ensuring accurate saving and uploading of documentation.
Communicate effectively with investigators to transcribe and clarify detailed information.
Communication and Support:
Provide support to the FIU team, addressing data-related queries and assisting in report preparation.
Interact with a diverse range of individuals, applying tact, diplomacy, and discretion.

Knowledge and Skills Required:

Educational Background:
Bachelor's degree from a recognized Canadian university, preferably in a related field such as Data Science, Statistics, Finance, or Business Administration.
Technical Proficiency:
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and SharePoint.
Familiarity with data entry tools and office equipment.
Analytical Skills:
Strong ability to gather, organize, and interpret data.
Systematic thinker with excellent problem-solving capabilities.
Organizational and Administrative Skills:
High level of attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to manage tasks independently with minimal direction.
Strong initiative and self-management skills.
Communication and Interpersonal Skills:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to interact with various stakeholders, demonstrating tact and confidentiality.
Work Environment:
Ability to work effectively in a hybrid setting, balancing in-office and remote work.
Comfort with extended periods of computer use.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Business Data Analyst




Employment Type: Contract




Industry: Biomedical Technology




Location: Remote




Role Description:

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will gather, process, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. Your role involves working closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs, developing reports and visualizations, and presenting findings in a clear and impactful manner. You will also support strategic initiatives by providing data-driven recommendations to enhance business performance.




Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field.
Have a deep understanding of systems and data architecture, design, and integrations.
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks), and reporting packages (Business Objects, Power BI, etc.).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




Preferred Requirements:

N/A




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with key stakeholders across divisions, ETO, and the group to capture business requirements and translate them into technical needs.
Develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques, providing ongoing reports.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and clean data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Maintain data security and confidentiality in all tasks.
Communicate effectively with various stakeholders at different levels within the organization, presenting findings and making recommendations.




FTSi.Tech Disclosure:

FTSi.Tech serves as a staffing agency, not the end client for this position. Our mission is to connect candidates with superior career opportunities while delivering exceptional talent to our clients. We are committed to facilitating successful and mutually beneficial placements for both candidates and clients. Your Success Is Our Focus!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Last Bottle Wines Inc., Digital Beverage Group (DBG), you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our ecommerce operations. By managing and optimizing product data across all our retail properties, you will directly influence the customer experience and drive revenue growth. Your expertise in analyzing behavioral and transactional data will uncover insights that propel our business forward. You will collaborate with product and technology teams to develop data models and specifications and provide analysis on potential acquisition targets. You will be an essential part of a growing team that is a leading player in wine ecommerce.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

The essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following:

Own and execute processes for managing product data across internal databases and ecommerce systems
Collaborate with product and technology teams to develop data models and specifications for new and existing systems
Analyze ecommerce behavioral and transactional data to identify trends and insights
Analyze data from potential acquisition targets and make informed recommendations based on your analysis
Compile and enter new product and pricing data into internal systems for ecommerce operations and training learning models
Ensure data integrity and consistency across all retail properties and internal systems
Provide actionable insights and reports to support decision-making processes
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of data into ecommerce platforms

Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):

3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in ecommerce or retail
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights
Proficient in SQL and experience with relational databases
Familiarity with ecommerce platforms and data management tools
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present findings to stakeholders
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Attention to detail and a strong commitment to data accuracy and quality
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and training learning models
Understanding of ecommerce merchandising and product data management




Physical Demands and Work Environment:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.

What Can We Offer You?

You’ll join a committed team with a strong culture focused on delivering the best to our customers in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment. Our employees are friendly, diverse, inclusive, hard-working, supportive, and fun! In addition to a great culture, we offer a competitive compensation package, including medical, dental, vision, HSA/FSA, 401k with a match, education benefits, wine purchase benefits, 16 days PTO, and 10 paid holidays.

DBG is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. We are committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, services, programs, and activities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company

At Jets.com, we are dedicated to delivering premium experiences in private aviation. Our products are designed to enhance client interactions, streamline scheduling, and optimize trip management. As we expand, we’re seeking an experienced Product Manager to take ownership of our product strategy, development, and execution.




About the Role

Jets.com is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support our data-driven decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will work closely with the CTO and key stakeholders to create and manage reports using SQL and Retool, while also leveraging predictive analytics to drive insights for pricing strategies. This role requires strong analytical skills, experience with Python for predictive modeling, and the ability to operationalize solutions based on historical data.

***Role can be Hybrid or Remote***




Responsibilities

Collaborate with the CTO and stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Write, manage, and maintain reports using SQL and Retool.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and insights that can improve business decisions.
Operationalize predictive pricing and other models based on historical data to support key business initiatives.
Provide data-driven recommendations for improving business processes and outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports and analyses.




Qualifications

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating data.
Experience with Retool or similar tools for building custom reports and dashboards.
Strong skills in Python for data analysis and predictive analytics.
Experience in predictive modeling, including the ability to operationalize models for business use cases.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics).




Perks and Benefits:

Paid Vacation: We believe in the importance of work-life balance, and that's why we offer generous paid vacation time so you can recharge and return refreshed.

401k Match: Secure your financial future with our 401k match program, ensuring your hard work pays off in the long run.

Employer Contribution Towards Medical: Your well-being matters to us. We offer a competitive medical benefits package to keep you in top shape.

Exciting Team Activities: Beyond the numbers, we enjoy fostering camaraderie through team-building events and activities that add some fun to the mix.




Disclaimer:

The pay range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000 per year. When making a job offer, we consider several factors in our determination, such as years of related work experience; relevant skills and qualifications; education level; and certifications/licenses. Candidates will be required to sign a Nondisclosure/ Confidentiality Agreement.




If you're passionate and wish to contribute to a thrilling aviation firm that values teamwork, customer satisfaction, and employee well-being, we want to hear from you! Join us on this exhilarating journey, and together, we'll reach new heights.

HTML:
About the Company

At Jets.com, we are dedicated to delivering premium experiences in private aviation. Our products are designed to enhance client interactions, streamline scheduling, and optimize trip management. As we expand, we’re seeking an experienced Product Manager to take ownership of our product strategy, development, and execution.


About the Role

Jets.com is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support our data-driven decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will work closely with the CTO and key stakeholders to create and manage reports using SQL and Retool, while also leveraging predictive analytics to drive insights for pricing strategies. This role requires strong analytical skills, experience with Python for predictive modeling, and the ability to operationalize solutions based on historical data.

***Role can be Hybrid or Remote***


Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the CTO and stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.
  • Write, manage, and maintain reports using SQL and Retool.
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and insights that can improve business decisions.
  • Operationalize predictive pricing and other models based on historical data to support key business initiatives.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations for improving business processes and outcomes.
  • Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports and analyses.


Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
  • Proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating data.
  • Experience with Retool or similar tools for building custom reports and dashboards.
  • Strong skills in Python for data analysis and predictive analytics.
  • Experience in predictive modeling, including the ability to operationalize models for business use cases.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics).


Perks and Benefits:

Paid Vacation: We believe in the importance of work-life balance, and that's why we offer generous paid vacation time so you can recharge and return refreshed.

401k Match: Secure your financial future with our 401k match program, ensuring your hard work pays off in the long run.

Employer Contribution Towards Medical: Your well-being matters to us. We offer a competitive medical benefits package to keep you in top shape.

Exciting Team Activities: Beyond the numbers, we enjoy fostering camaraderie through team-building events and activities that add some fun to the mix.


Disclaimer:

The pay range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000 per year. When making a job offer, we consider several factors in our determination, such as years of related work experience; relevant skills and qualifications; education level; and certifications/licenses. Candidates will be required to sign a Nondisclosure/ Confidentiality Agreement.


If you're passionate and wish to contribute to a thrilling aviation firm that values teamwork, customer satisfaction, and employee well-being, we want to hear from you! Join us on this exhilarating journey, and together, we'll reach new heights.

Title: Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Location: Chicago

Want to make an impact?

The primary role of the Business Intelligence Analyst is to support the development of strategic analyses, help build reporting dashboards and frameworks, and help own reporting and sales performance measurement for the organization. This individual will be responsible for owning and unlocking the power of the data streams coming into the company, including but not limited to point-of-sale, consumer panel, and consumption data to help drive meaningful impact for the organization both US and Internationally. The role will be expected to provide a strong perspective on the way we bring data to life for the company and help support the vision of business intelligence for the future.

Ways you will make a difference


Lead the reporting and analysis of point-of-sale and consumer panel data monthly, highlighting key action areas and presenting strategic insights to Senior Leadership.
Proactively uncover strategic insights utilizing consumer data and business performance to drive critical actions, helping shape strategy to grow the business.
Provide consumer analytics thought leadership, collaborate on best practice approaches with cross-functional teams, and translate data into actionable insights for the business.
Design and create dashboards, automate reporting through platforms like Power BI, and execute the analytics learning agenda for the current year while planning for future acceleration.
Manage existing dataset maintenance, new item coding, and vendor relationships to ensure we are maximizing our partnerships and getting the best out of our data.
Help support and execute the evolution of the analytics function within Ferrara with advanced analytics to shape a more data driven organization
Audit the existing vendors and outside landscape of new vendors and capabilities to bring further expertise and tools in house with best-in-class suppliers.
Up to 10% travel, when necessary


Skills that will make you successful


Insatiably and intellectually curious – motivated to dig into data, inspired to deliver accurate and actionable insights
Ability to learn quickly, problem solve creatively and communicate persuasively; and then act with agility
Collaborative, able to work with several internal and external stakeholders and present data in a professional and organized fashion
Ability to intake qualitative and quantitative data from various sources and streamline into concise findings.
Having an ownership mentality with a drive to be a partner to the business
An interest in data visualization and using it to support effective data storytelling
A passion for knowledge and staying up to date on the latest trends in technology / analytics to bring outside thinking to the organization
Strong oral/written communication and storytelling skills
Strong attention to detail with an eye towards process improvement
Comfort working independently and through ambiguity
Bias for action and passion for delivering results


Experiences that will support your success


Education: Bachelor's degree
Years of experience: 1-2 years
Other qualifications/certifications:
Experience in CPG relevant/area of business intelligence / consumer analytics
Proficiency with Microsoft Office with advanced Excel skills
Experience with point of sale and consumer panel data (IRI / Nielsen)
Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization packages
Experience with NPD in-home consumption data
Python and SQL skills are a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Curinos empowers financial institutions to make better, faster and more profitable decisions through industry-leading proprietary data, technologies and insights. With decades-long expertise in the financial services industry and a relentless focus on the future, Curinos technology and analytics ecosystem allows clients to anticipate customer needs and optimize their go-to market decisions in an increasingly competitive market.


Curinos operates under a hybrid modality. This individual may work from the New York City or Chicago office.




Job Description






Implementing and supporting one or more of Curinos’ software solutions
Becoming the SME on our clients’ data and platform configuration, including:
Configuring and customizing our solutions to client-specific data, strategies, and business needs
Mining, cleaning, and analyzing large data sets for trends or insights relevant to Curinos Solutions clients’ analysis
Deriving and communicating actionable conclusions from complex data
Gathering, mapping, and validating data to power our analytical platforms
Calibrating and updating models used in solutions to enhance accuracy and impact
Conducting statistical analysis to evaluate model performance
Building out processes and procedures to more efficiently support configuration activities across our growing client base
Advising on and participating in the use of client data to support other initiatives at the firm
Completing other tasks and projects, as requested


Qualifications






Bachelor’s degree from a top tier university, preferably in business, science, math, or computer science
0-3 years of experience, preferably in computer programming, consulting or financial services
0-3 years of experience working in SQL or with relational databases
Strong problem-solving abilities, especially when it comes to investigating and resolving data anomalies
Well-developed organizational skills to facilitate handling multiple concurrent workstreams; attention to detail
Exceptional analytical capabilities including the ability to develop and interpret complex analytics
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an emphasis on translation of code and/or data into business terms
Ability to work independently; demonstrated ability to work in a multi-tasked, fast-paced, and changing environment
Ability to travel as needed for client meetings; can range from 0% to 100% depending on engagement, but will most likely be up to a few days per month

Base Salary Range: $67,500 - $75,000 (bonus potential)




Additional Information



Why work at Curinos?


Competitive benefits, including a range of Financial, Health and Lifestyle benefits to choose from
Flexible working options, including home working, flexible hours and part time options, depending on the role requirements – please ask!
Competitive annual leave, floating holidays, volunteering days and a day off for your birthday!
Learning and development tools to assist with your career development
Work with industry leading Subject Matter Experts and specialist products
Regular social events and networking opportunities
Collaborative, supportive culture, including an active DE&I program
Employee Assistance Program which provides expert third-party advice on wellbeing, relationships, legal and financial matters, as well as access to counselling services

Applying:


We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't meet all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have relevant skills or experience, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need!


If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats, special requirements to access our buildings or adjusted interview formats please contact us at careers@curinos.com and we’ll do everything we can to help.


Inclusivity at Curinos:


We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed.  As such, Curinos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst IV

Location-Type: Remote

Start Date Is: ASAP

Duration: 3-month contract with potential to extend

Compensation Range: 55-70/hr W2




Job Description:

The client is seeking a skilled Data Analyst to manage and standardize high volumes of data, ensuring data quality and integrity.. The ideal candidate will excel in SQL, data analysis, and data profiling, with a strong focus on standardizing and harmonizing data from multiple systems.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities:

Analyze and profile large datasets to identify patterns and trends.
Utilize SQL to query and manipulate data.
Leverage Excel and Power BI to report on data insights and findings.
Ensure data quality using tools like Informatica or Ataccama.
Collaborate to standardize data collection and storage processes.
Work with cataloging tools (Purview, Collibra) to organize and maintain data structures.
Requirements:
5+ years of data analysis experience.
Strong SQL coding skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Power BI.
Experience with data quality tools such as Informatica or Ataccama.
Experience with cataloging tools like Purview or Collibra.

Nice-to-Haves:

Experience in the retail industry.
Familiarity with Python for data manipulation and analysis.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Skylight is a technology startup based out of Los Angeles and San Francisco. Our mission is to make technology that brings families together. Our founders are former venture capitalists and serial entrepreneurs, who have scaled this business to $100M+ in annual revenue while being completely bootstrapped. We think often about the thousands of smiles we are able to put on our customers' faces each day, and it fills our hearts with purpose. That's why we have been working hard to expand our team and invent, so that we can continue to bring the magic of Skylight to millions of loved ones throughout the world.

We are ready to hire our first Product Data Analyst to lead our center of excellence for data analytics. This role will enable product, engineering, customer service, marketing, and executive teams by providing insightful data analysis, regular reporting, and self-service tools.

Responsibilities:


Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with various teams to identify data needs and methodologies
Project Management: Lead data projects independently, ensuring timely delivery
Data Analysis: Collect, structure, and interpret complex data into actionable insights
Dashboard Development: Create and maintain dashboards to communicate performance metrics
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models to support business functions
Tool Utilization: Use tools like Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, and Metabase for data management and analysis


Continuous Improvement: Automate processes and optimize data delivery.

Requirements


Experience: 3+ years in a data analyst role; 2+ years with large datasets and enterprise data warehouse solutions
Technical Skills: Expert in SQL and familiarity with data tools like Snowflake, dbt, and Metabase
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills
Project Management: Proven project management skills with a focus on autonomy
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment



Benefits

Our competitive compensation package includes:


Competitive Salary + Equity Package
401K matching
Wellness, learning, and home-office budgets
Health, Dental & Vision Medical Plans
Tremendous autonomy to set the direction of your work
Unlimited PTO
Company holidays on the first Friday of every month (Except November & December)


Equal opportunity employer

Skylight is committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you're the best person for the job, we want you on board!

For Colorado-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience and for California-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of this law.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Contract: 4 Months (Extension Likely)

Pay Rate: $20-$25/HR DOE




Description

Data Analyst will be responsible for helping build and maintain our master data. The Analyst will own cleaning and processing vendor catalogs on a regular basis and in a timely manner for a particular set of vendors, as well as processing data change request tickets.
The Analyst will work with other teams to identify, root cause, and fix data discrepancies to continuously maintain the accuracy of our product and vendor information.
The candidate must have 2+ years of experience with data entry, management, and/or analysis.
Must be detail-oriented, with strong Excel/Google Sheet skills (SQL would be a bonus).
Should also have a strong ownership mentality and effective written/verbal communication skills.

Pride Global offers eligible employee’s comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, and vision plans), supplemental coverage (accident insurance, critical illness insurance and hospital indemnity), 401(k)-retirement savings, life & disability insurance, an employee assistance program, legal support, auto, home insurance, pet insurance and employee discounts with preferred vendors.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Tableau)
Description:
Brite Consulting is a management and technology consulting firm dedicated to delivering value-added services that impact the public and private sectors. We work closely with our clients to optimize their operational needs and provide innovative solutions that help them achieve their missions.




We are a small business with a big heart. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed, and we are committed to providing the highest quality of service. Join us in building a brighter future. 




Job Overview:

We are seeking a proactive and skilled Data Analyst with hands-on experience in Tableau to join our team. The ideal candidate will be capable of building basic Tableau dashboards. This role is suited for someone with a solid foundation in data analysis who is ready to take on more responsibility and grow their expertise in data visualization and business intelligence.




Qualifications:

1-2 years of experience in data analysis with a focus on Tableau.
Proven ability to create interactive and visually appealing Tableau dashboards independently.
Advanced Excel skills
Proficiency in data manipulation, cleansing, and analysis.
Basic knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement data-driven solutions using Tableau for various business units, starting from day one.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Clean, transform, and analyze datasets to extract meaningful patterns and trends.
Create and maintain Tableau dashboards and reports for regular reporting needs.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization through data analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Stay updated on industry best practices and advancements in Tableau and data analytics.

 

Location: 

San Antonio, Texas




Travel Required:

N/A




Hours: 

8:00 am - 4:30 pm




Minimum Required Years of Experience: 

1 – 2 years 




Education Requirements: 

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Statistics, or Computer Science)




Security Clearance/Investigation: 

T-3 Investigation/Tier II 

 

Preferred Skillset: 

Tableau Desktop and Server certification
Experience with other data visualization tools. 
Familiarity with statistical analysis and modeling. 
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts. 

 

Job Type:  

Full-time 

 

Benefits: 

401(k) 
401(k) matching 
Dental Insurance 
Health insurance 
Vision insurance 
Life insurance 
Disability insurance 
Paid time off 
Flexible schedule 
Professional development assistance 
Referral program
Bonus pay

  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization through data analysis.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
  • Stay updated on industry best practices and advancements in Tableau and data analytics.

 

Location: 

  • San Antonio, Texas


Travel Required:

  • N/A


Hours: 

  • 8:00 am - 4:30 pm


Minimum Required Years of Experience: 

  • 1 – 2 years 


Education Requirements: 

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Statistics, or Computer Science)


Security Clearance/Investigation: 

  • T-3 Investigation/Tier II 

 

Preferred Skillset: 

  • Tableau Desktop and Server certification
  • Experience with other data visualization tools. 
  • Familiarity with statistical analysis and modeling. 
  • Knowledge of data warehousing concepts. 

 

Job Type:  

  • Full-time 

 

Benefits: 

  • 401(k) 
  • 401(k) matching 
  • Dental Insurance 
  • Health insurance 
  • Vision insurance 
  • Life insurance 
  • Disability insurance 
  • Paid time off 
  • Flexible schedule 
  • Professional development assistance 
  • Referral program
  • Bonus pay

Title: Site Analytics Analyst
Description:
New York, NY, United States

Full time Schedule




$77,160 - $128,640 Annually*




Bring Your Amazing Self to Work

At Macy's, Inc. we're on a mission to create a brighter future with bold representation for all. This is our Mission Every One. We know that each person here is unique. So we respect and invest in each individual to create growth, pride, and satisfaction. If we are able to bring our whole selves to work, it translates into a more abundant and wider array of ideas and energy for all to benefit from. Our success will be built on amazing colleagues, working together.




Job Overview

The Site Analytics Analyst enables and empowers the site merchandising organization with analytic insight to support strategic planning, tactical execution, and optimization of the customer experience. This position develops and delivers business intelligence and presents actionable reporting and analysis to support decision-makers. They support the Apparel business by analyzing FOB performance in collaboration with cross-functional teams such as Marketing and Merchandising. They must multi-task through stages of multiple projects and deliver quality insights and impactful recommendations regularly to drive business decisions and growth.




What You Will Do

Support the Site Merchandising team by understanding FOB performance and identifying opportunities for an improved site experience. Develop measurement plans and KPIs to gauge the success of new optimizations and strategies on the site.
Partner with Site Merchandising, Marketing, and Omni Merchandising to provide a digital perspective on category analysis and insights.
Utilize analytics tools to answer business questions and communicate performance, insights, and actionable recommendations to stakeholders.
Produce ad hoc analyses requested by FOB teams to meet business objectives. Develop and publish reports and dashboards.
Administer Analytics Office Hours bi-weekly, developing content and delivering training to the site merchandising organization.
Collaborate with site merchandising leadership to create Adobe dashboards and a measurement approach that leads to automation and reporting efficiencies. Monitor data integrity within the Adobe data set, reporting potential issues to management to ensure the accuracy of enterprise data.




Skills You Will Need

Analytical Skills: Strong proficiency in analyzing performance metrics and deriving actionable insights.

Business Intelligence: Ability to develop and deliver comprehensive business intelligence and reporting to support decision-makers.

Collaboration: Experience working with cross-functional teams, including Site Merchandising, Marketing, and Omni Merchandising.

Technical Proficiency: Expertise in utilizing analytics tools and developing Adobe dashboards for data analysis and reporting.

Communication: Effective in communicating performance insights and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.

Project Management: Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.

Strategic Planning: Aptitude for developing measurement plans and KPIs to gauge the success of site optimizations and strategies.

Initiative: Motivated to research and monitor business performance in real time, identifying issues and opportunities as they occur.

Ownership: Strong desire and ability to take ownership of projects and drive them to successful completion.

Who You Are

Dedicated to fulfilling ideals of diversity, inclusion, and respect that Macy’s aspires to achieve every day in every way.
Candidates with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field are encouraged to apply.
Regularly required to sit, talk, hear; use hands/fingers to touch, handle, and feel. Occasionally required to move about the workplace and reach with hands and arms. Requires close vision.
Able to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.

What We Can Offer You

An inclusive, challenging, and refreshingly fun work environment
Competitive pay and benefits rooted in principles of equity
Performance incentives and annual merit review
Merchandise discounts
Health and Wellness Benefits across medical, dental, vision, and additional insurance
Retirement Savings Plan with 401k match opportunity
Employee Assistance Program (mental health counseling and legal/financial advice)
Resources for continuous learning, career growth, and leadership development
8 paid holidays
Paid Time Off (first year prorated depending on start date)
Tuition reimbursement program
Guild education benefit funds 100% of tuition, books, and fees in designated programs
Colleague Resource Groups (CRGs) and give-back/volunteer opportunities
Empowerment and autonomy to perform impactful work with tangible results

About Macy’s

Now is an exciting time for a Macy's career as we continue to focus on creating exciting and memorable experiences for every Macy's customer, whether their journey starts online or in the store. Our opportunities in Sales, Merchandise, Operations, Customer Service, Warehouse, Marketing, and other areas let you express your creativity and commitment to excellence, grow your career and make a difference to your Macy's colleagues and customers.

Bring your creativity, energy, and ideas to the Macy's team – Apply Today!

This job description is not all-inclusive. Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location Requirement: Candidate MUST be in Cincinnati, OH, and be available to work in the downtown office on a hybrid schedule (on-site Mon, Tues, Weds, remote Thurs & Fri.)




We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Analyst for a 6-month W-2 contract-to-hire position. You will play a critical role in maintaining and developing business reporting functions, transforming large datasets, and providing data-driven insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Assist with the maintenance of daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly business reporting functions.
Gather Retail Operations data from multiple databases, platforms, stakeholders, and 3rd party vendors for analysis.
Transform large data sets through data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.
Leverage Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to build and maintain custom reports and dashboards to reveal trends and correlations.
Implement row-level security in Power BI (and other tools) for secured viewing of reports based on job levels and locations.
Identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities and improve processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs for executing strategic objectives and initiatives.
Identify and communicate data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, manager, and team.
Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making.

Requirements:

Proficient in R (data cleaning, performing calculations on large datasets, performing exploratory data analysis) and occasional use of Python.
Strong expertise in Power BI, especially with DAX, Power Query, Dataflows, Row-Level Security (RLS), and writing measures with DAX.
A great eye for visualization and a focus on user experience—our team prioritizes making reports visually appealing and user-friendly.
Experience in standardizing and solidifying data processes and quality.
Ability to problem-solve and investigate issues while participating in system testing across multiple feature and component teams.
Experience in Agile Project Management, including completing estimates and work plans in Program Increments (PI) meetings.

Title: HR Data and Financial Analyst
Description:
Summary:

We're seeking a highly motivated HR Finance Analyst to join our HR team. In this role, you'll leverage data to align our people strategy with our business objectives, ensure data accuracy, and support various HR processes. You'll also work cross-functionally with the finance team to analyze all financial metrics related to HR. The ideal candidate will have a track record of effectively using data to drive business decisions. You'll manage HR data, develop, and maintain HR reports.

To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in HR cost control management and be proficient in analyzing and interpreting financial data.




Job Responsibilities:




Develop and implement HR data analysis and reporting strategies aligned with company objectives
Manage headcount data and HR Finance data this includes Payroll Planning, Payroll Accrual & Reconciliation, Fringe Calculations, Sales Bonus, and Re-billing
Manage HR budgeting and forecasting processes
Provide analysis on variances between actuals vs budgets
Prepare monthly and year-end commentary on forecasted vs actual personnel costs
Forecast monthly, quarterly and annual HR General Expenses
Collect and analyze HR data from various sources, including HRIS, payroll, and performance management systems
Develop and maintain HR dashboards and analytics tools to streamline HR processes and provide actionable insights to HR and senior leadership
Partner with HR, payroll, and finance teams to ensure data accuracy and compliance
Prepare and present HR reports and analysis to inform decision-making
Provide quarterly analysis on incentive plan performance, retail staff productivity, and identify trends
Analyze costs trends on a monthly basis work closely with Finance partners
Recommend process and system improvements to optimize workflow and reporting
This position will have some responsibility for Canada on a back up basis.




Requirements/Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, or a related field preferred
At least 2 years of HR data and HR Finance forecasting and budgeting experience.
Demonstrated success in developing and implementing HR data analysis and reporting strategies that have improved business outcomes
Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, patterns, and insights, and make data-driven recommendations to improve HR policies, practices, and programs
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner that is easily understandable to non-technical audiences
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis tools to manipulate and analyze large data sets and produce insightful reports and visualizations
Strong attention to detail, with a commitment to accuracy and data integrity
Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize workload effectively to meet deadlines




Core Values and Traits:

Play as One Team:

Showing respect towards everyone
Commitment for the team’s work and decisions

Play with Elegance:

Striving for excellence
Treating others with fair play and humility

Play by Daring:

Having the courage to speak up, experiment and take initiative
To explore new opportunities

Play with Tenacity:

Constantly seek continuous improvement
Learning from our failures

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $121,800 - $220,300. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
About PrePass

PrePass® is North America's most utilized and technologically advanced weigh station bypass and toll payment platform. Proven PrePass technologies enable safe, qualified motor carriers to bypass inspection facilities at highway speeds, saving them time, fuel, and money while reducing emissions. As the only provider to offer bypass and tolling solutions, PrePass technology allows fleets to regain control of toll costs, eliminate toll violations, and automatically resolve max toll disputes. PrePass is the only preclearance system developed, owned, and operated in the United States of America as well as the American Trucking Associations' only Endorsed Corporate Partner. That's why more than 105,000 fleets subscribe over 750,000 commercial vehicles to PrePass services.

Position Description

We are seeking a BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence Team. This position will report to the Senior Manager of Business Intelligence. You will be responsible for translating data into actionable insights for our company. The role collaborates with business and technical stakeholders to better understand goals and objectives. This is a Remote position, but does require occasional travel to our Downtown Phoenix office (across from the Footprint Center).

Key Responsibilities


Design, build, and deploy BI solutions as translated by business need.
Maintain, support and improve existing BI systems and data analytics platforms (e.g., PowerBI primarily)
Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting to identify areas of improvement in current operations.
Gather, analyze, and interpret data with accuracy and reliability to provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders that drive business decisions.
Create reports, dashboards, stories, and visualizations for requested projects that supports quantitative and qualitative data analysis
Collaborate with BI developers and data engineers to integrate systems and convert business requirements into technical specifications
Develop and update technical documentation.
Provide reporting solutions and respond to ad-hoc report requests across multiple business areas



Requirements


Qualifications


Required


Proven experience as a BI Analyst
Proficiency with data visualization tools, specifically PowerBI
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g., Microsoft Power Platforms, Tableau, QlikView)
Basic SQL knowledge
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field



Preferred


Advanced SQL skills; familiarity with No-SQL databases
Experience creating and maintaining ETL pipelines and automation
Understanding of data lake architecture and design principles
Familiarity with DevOps CI/CD implementation methodologies
Exceptional collaborative abilities, with a talent for navigating fluid environments and embracing change



Benefits


How We Will Take Care of You


Robust benefit package that includes medical, dental, and vision that start on date of hire
Paid Time Off, to include vacation, sick, holidays, and floating holidays
401(k) plan with employer match
Company-funded "lifestyle account" upon date of hire for you to apply toward your physical and mental well-being (i.e., ski passes, retreats, gym memberships)
Tuition Reimbursement Program
Voluntary benefits, to include but not limited to Legal and Pet Discounts
Employee Assistance Program (available at no cost to you)
Company-sponsored and funded "Culture Team" that focuses on the Physical, Mental, and Professional well-being of employees
Community Give-Back initiatives
Culture that focuses on employee development initiatives
