Title: Lead Data Analyst
Company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts
Description:
Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.

What We Need

The Lead Data Analyst will support delivery across multiple data platforms including the cloud-based Data Analytics Layer (DAL) and the on-prem Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW). The Lead Data Analyst will support new solutions, enhancements, operational changes, and the migration of existing EDW applications and solutions to the DAL. The Lead Data Analyst will work closely with technology vendor partners to support data ingestion, transformation, storage, and delivery for operational and analytical solutions. This role will work closely with data scrum teams including developers, testers, scrum masters, product owners, and subject matter experts.

As a member of the Agile scrum team, the Lead Data Analyst will conduct spike analysis to support estimation, scheduling, and backlog refinement activities. They will enhance user stories with technical specifications to support development and testing. This role will participate or lead cross-functional team meetings as a representative of the Data Analytics and Insights team to ensure capabilities, technology, resource capacity, and delivery status are communicated and understood by enterprise partners. This role will also work with developers and testers to address open questions and clarify requirements and specifications defined in user stories.

Your Day to Day


Lead cross-divisional project teams in the implementation of data driven projects for consumers, providers, and accounts.
Create data specific artifacts supporting portfolio initiatives, projects, and operational enhancements.
Act as liaison with internal and external (vendor) teams to deliver requirements, specifications, and definitions required for successful Agile implementation.
Participate in scrum ceremonies and support the definition of epics and user stories using Jira.
Build, organize, and maintain and process, technical, and solution specific content including design documents, roadmaps, data mapping, reference documents, and workflows in Confluence.


We’re Looking For


Deep knowledge of healthcare data domains including (but not limited to) enrollment, account, claims, providers, products, digital, clinical, financial, and wellness data.
Designs, develops, and programs operational data integration, extracts, reports, dashboards, and scorecards to support complex business needs of internal partners.
Leverages an expansive knowledge of structured query language (SQL) to program and creates reports for the informatics/analyst community.
Builds deep knowledge of healthcare domain by engaging in delivery, operations, & analytics initiatives
Provides complex operational analysis on healthcare data sets and maintains Health Informatics web content.
Assists in the data definitions requirements critical to the successful implementation of data-driven projects through the development of effective working relationships with key internal and external customers.
Knowledge and understanding of data ingestion, transformation, storage, security, and exchange.
Experience developing queries using data mining and/or business intelligence tools.
Experience translating enterprise requirements into technical specifications for development teams.
Knowledge of data validation approaches to confirm and document results meet expectations.
Ability to estimate, inform, and negotiate expectations that meet enterprise partner and technical delivery needs.
Experience working on Agile teams to deliver ongoing value throughout the entire product lifecycle.


What You Bring


Bachelors degree preferred
10+ years data analyst experience
5+ years of experience in healthcare
5+ years of experience using SQL and BI tools


What You’ll Gain

It is our mission at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts to foster a culture that enables associates to do their best work while living happy and healthy lives. That's why we offer you a variety of ways to support your best physical, emotional, financial, and social well-being. For more information on our benefit offerings, visit https://careers.bluecrossma.org/us/en/benefits

Minimum Education Requirements

High school degree or equivalent required unless otherwise noted above

Location

Boston, Hingham

Time Type

Full time

Salary Range: $130,000.00 - $164,010.00

The job posting range is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, and business or organizational needs and affordability.

This job is also eligible for variable pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and a suite of well-being benefits to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

WHY Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA?

We understand that the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can prevent amazing candidates coming our way, so please don’t hesitate to apply. We’d love to hear from you. You might be just what we need for this role or possibly another one at Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be brilliant. We encourage you to bring us your true colors, , your perspectives, and your experiences. It’s in our differences that we will remain relentless in our pursuit to transform healthcare for ALL.

As an employer, we are committed to investing in your development and providing the necessary resources to enable your success. Learn how we are dedicated to creating an inclusive and rewarding workplace that promotes excellence and provides opportunities for employees to forge their unique career path by visiting our Company Culture page. If this sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, we’d love to hear from you. You can also join our Talent Community to stay “in the know” on all things Blue.

At Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, we believe in wellness and that work/life balance is a key part of associate wellbeing. For more information on how we work and support that work/life balance visit our "How We Work" Page.

  • Act as liaison with internal and external (vendor) teams to deliver requirements, specifications, and definitions required for successful Agile implementation.
  • Participate in scrum ceremonies and support the definition of epics and user stories using Jira.
  • Build, organize, and maintain and process, technical, and solution specific content including design documents, roadmaps, data mapping, reference documents, and workflows in Confluence.

We’re Looking For

  • Deep knowledge of healthcare data domains including (but not limited to) enrollment, account, claims, providers, products, digital, clinical, financial, and wellness data.
  • Designs, develops, and programs operational data integration, extracts, reports, dashboards, and scorecards to support complex business needs of internal partners.
  • Leverages an expansive knowledge of structured query language (SQL) to program and creates reports for the informatics/analyst community.
  • Builds deep knowledge of healthcare domain by engaging in delivery, operations, & analytics initiatives
  • Provides complex operational analysis on healthcare data sets and maintains Health Informatics web content.
  • Assists in the data definitions requirements critical to the successful implementation of data-driven projects through the development of effective working relationships with key internal and external customers.
  • Knowledge and understanding of data ingestion, transformation, storage, security, and exchange.
  • Experience developing queries using data mining and/or business intelligence tools.
  • Experience translating enterprise requirements into technical specifications for development teams.
  • Knowledge of data validation approaches to confirm and document results meet expectations.
  • Ability to estimate, inform, and negotiate expectations that meet enterprise partner and technical delivery needs.
  • Experience working on Agile teams to deliver ongoing value throughout the entire product lifecycle.

What You Bring

  • Bachelors degree preferred
  • 10+ years data analyst experience
  • 5+ years of experience in healthcare
  • 5+ years of experience using SQL and BI tools

What You’ll Gain

It is our mission at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts to foster a culture that enables associates to do their best work while living happy and healthy lives. That's why we offer you a variety of ways to support your best physical, emotional, financial, and social well-being. For more information on our benefit offerings, visit https://careers.bluecrossma.org/us/en/benefits

Minimum Education Requirements

High school degree or equivalent required unless otherwise noted above

Location

Boston, Hingham

Time Type

Full time

Salary Range: $130,000.00 - $164,010.00

The job posting range is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, and business or organizational needs and affordability.

This job is also eligible for variable pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and a suite of well-being benefits to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

WHY Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA?

We understand that the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can prevent amazing candidates coming our way, so please don’t hesitate to apply. We’d love to hear from you. You might be just what we need for this role or possibly another one at Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be brilliant. We encourage you to bring us your true colors, , your perspectives, and your experiences. It’s in our differences that we will remain relentless in our pursuit to transform healthcare for ALL.

As an employer, we are committed to investing in your development and providing the necessary resources to enable your success. Learn how we are dedicated to creating an inclusive and rewarding workplace that promotes excellence and provides opportunities for employees to forge their unique career path by visiting our Company Culture page. If this sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, we’d love to hear from you. You can also join our Talent Community to stay “in the know” on all things Blue.

At Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, we believe in wellness and that work/life balance is a key part of associate wellbeing. For more information on how we work and support that work/life balance visit our "How We Work" Page.

R07300

Title: Healthcare Data Analyst - Quality
Description:
Job Summary


Reporting to the Clinical Quality Director, the Healthcare Data Analyst- Quality serves as a subject matter expert in data analysis, demonstrating an in-depth understanding of clinical quality and other business data. Develops the departmental analytical capabilities to produce reports and dashboards needed for short and long-term decision-making and to achieve success in managing performance improvement and safety initiatives.
The Healthcare Data Analyst-Quality partners with members of the Quality team within the Quality and Patient Safety department and the Emerson Information Systems staff to create and maintain a seamless process for fulfilling the data needs of the Quality Department and support external quality data reporting. Acts as a liaison and technical expert in the implementation and use of new IT tools or databases.
The Healthcare Data Analyst-Quality works closely with other hospital departments to ensure the optimal functionality of data extraction from EMR software, clinical processes, and the flow of information between Quality and Patient Safety and other areas of the hospital.


Minimum Qualifications


Education
BA/BS required
Experience
Experience in data analytics in a healthcare setting preferred.
Familiarity with various coding/datasets (ICD-10, CPT4, HCPCS) and an understanding of the assignment of DRG values for hospital claims reimbursement preferred.
Knowledge of medical terminology.
Experience with reporting tools such as Crystal Reports or Tableau preferred.
Licensure and/or Certification
N/A
Skills
Strong analytic and data management skills, with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to appropriately scope and execute evaluation and analysis work.
Practical problem-solving abilities, i.e. the ability to formulate hypotheses, test options and move forward.
Experienced at evaluating requirements for projects and developing approaches to solving and building analytic solutions.
Ability to measure actual performance against benchmarks or targets.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Must be able to read, write, and communicate in English.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite required, including expertise with the creation of Pivot Tables and Access databases.
Ability to maintain confidential information.

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance - REMOTE
Description:
Put your Insurance Experience to work - FROM HOME!

At WAHVE we value significant insurance experience and want to revolutionize the way people think about phasing into retirement by offering qualified candidates the opportunity to continue their career working from home. As we say - retire from the office but not from work. Our unique platform provides you with real work/life balance and allows you to customize your own work schedule while continuing to utilize your insurance expertise in a remote, long-term position which includes company benefits!

What You’ll Love About Wahve

We created a welcoming place to work with friendly and professional leadership. We are known for the great care we take with our staff and our clients. We are passionate and determined about delivering the best customer service, preserving insurance industry knowledge, and making a difference by the work that we do.

What We Are Seeking

We have assignments available to help our insurance industry clients in Data Analyst positions. Responsibilities include:


Build and maintain data warehouse, new reports, and ad hoc reports.
Work with user groups to identify reporting issues/enhancements and document business requirements.
Will serve as a member of a project team and/or work independently on projects.
Support and train internal users as needed.
Compile and prepare data for customer analysis.
Experience in C#, Visual Studio, JavaScript, CSS, and current web technologies such as .NET, ASP, JSON, and XML.
Experience with ANY of the following technologies: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SSIS Reporting, Power BI, Dynamics CRM, Dynamics GP, Share point, Excel, Power Query, Power Pivot.
Ability to compile data results and author commentary on industry studies is a plus.
Insurance or financial services industry experience required. Current high demand for property CAT and AIR Catastrophe modeling skills.


TO BECOME A WORK-AT-HOME VINTAGE EXPERT, WE REQUIRE


25 years of full-time work experience
Experience working in a data analysis role in the insurance or financial services industry - required


Benefits Of Becoming a Wahve Vintage Expert


Health insurance based on eligibility.
401(k) with a 4% match.
Retire from the office but not from work.
Eliminate the office stress and the commute.
Choose the work you would like to do now.
Customize your schedule - full or part time.
Utilize your years of insurance industry knowledge.
Be part of our dynamic yet virtual team environment and connect with other experienced insurance professionals like yourself!


How To Get Started

Click APPLY NOW to complete our simple preliminary profile. Be sure to include your preferred contact information as one of our Qualification Specialists will connect with you promptly.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Job Title: Marketing Analyst II

Location: Hybrid role at - Marlborough, MA, 01752

Type : Contract – High possibility of extension

Duration : 3+ Months

Description:

Prepares analytics and insights across department as well as provides operational efficiency and optimization within the department.

Responsibilities:


Communicates and supports the Data Analytics strategy.
Determines customer requirements and translate requirements into reports for analysis.
Provides analysis and tracking of data through ongoing reporting, ad hoc analysis and partnership to share insights and ensure understanding within the business.
Uses data to highlight key organization trends and collaborate with businesses to identify causes, costs and potential interventions/solutions.
Participates in periodic audits and analyses to ensure accuracy, optimization of systems and reporting as well as new analytic opportunities.


Required:


Proficiency in both Python and SQL*Digital Data Expertise (experience with Google Analytics or Adobe) OR Marketing Analytics


Preferred


Able to build data pipelines and run predictive scoring effectively.
Have experience working on Snowflake, Databricks and AWS.
Familiar with Marketing and Sales.


Company Description

Senior Financial Risk Analyst experienced with risk management, exposure, market risk, asset liability models (ALM) mortgage- backed securities, using python, SQL, and visual reports for a financial service organization in New York City

Title: PowerBI / DataBricks / Python Consultant
Description:
PowerBI / DataBricks / Python Consultant.

Client Ahold Delhaize

Rate 70 + 5/hr W2

6 month contract to hire.

Hybrid 1-2 days a week on-site.


quincy, ma
salisbury, nc (near charlotte)
greenville, sc
carlisle, pa
scarborough, me
Chicago, IL


Reporting Analyst- dual role, extensive knowledge PowerBI Dax code, this person should know databricks and python code, how to interact databricks and save out different notebooks. In PowerBI know how to write dax code but also needs to be able to translate that visually- how to bring these stories alive to tell the best story. Highly collaborative- don't want someone who is going to go in and work in a corner and build a model by themselves- can connect with the business and work with the business and visualization aspect of it. ADF pipelines- should know how to write ADF pipelines*if they don't know how to, it's not going to hinder them. Data is out of different sources- They won't be presenting data to leadership but presenting to business and running work group meetings- no leadership responsibilities Retail or Grocery experience would be a plus. Certs- databricks, powerBI, etc.

Job Summary: We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst/Engineer to join our team. This dual-role position requires extensive experience with Power BI and DAX coding, as well as proficiency in Databricks and Python. The ideal candidate will have a strong ability to translate technical data into compelling visual stories and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain a union catalog in Databricks.
Utilize Python for data analysis and engineering tasks.
Write and manage ADF (Azure Data Factory) pipelines. While expertise in this area is highly desirable, willingness to learn is also acceptable.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and bring data stories to life.
Build and maintain Databricks notebooks, ensuring seamless interaction between Databricks and Python.
Pull data from various sources and integrate it into the Azure Data Lake.
Present data findings and visualizations to business stakeholders on a daily basis.


Qualifications


Proficiency in Databricks and Python.
Extensive experience with Power BI and DAX coding.
Ability to translate DAX code into visual stories.
Strong collaboration skills; ability to work closely with business stakeholders.
Experience in retail or grocery industries is a plus.


Power BI and Databricks certifications are a plus.

Title: Tableau Specialist
Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.

Job Description

Tableau Specialist, Data Analysis

Location: Waltham, MA (hybrid)

Get To Know The Team:

SS&C Intralinks is seeking a talented and motivated Sr. Business Operations Analyst to join our Product Development team. You will report to the Senior Director of Product Development Operations and work cross-functionally with our Product, FP&A, Sales Operations and Change Management teams to help deliver actionable insights to our product management and senior leadership teams.

Why You Will Love It Here!


Flexibility: Hybrid Work Model & Business Casual Dress Code
Your Future: 401k Matching Program, Professional Development Reimbursement
Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays
Your Wellbeing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave
Diversity & Inclusion: Committed to Welcoming, Celebrating and Thriving on Diversity
Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, including SS&C University
Extra Perks: Discounts on fitness clubs, travel and more!


What You Will Get To Do:


Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau and other BI solutions
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and provide actionable recommendations based on findings
Develop ROI model for new product initiatives
Help develop and maintain data dictionary and other documentation for data models, processes, and reporting standards to ensure knowledge sharing and consistency
Serve as a subject matter expert for all cross functional stakeholders needing timely and relevant data for their analyses
Monitor data quality and resolve any discrepancies or inconsistencies in collaboration with data engineering teams


What You Will Bring:


Bachelors’ degree or equivalent experience required
3-5 years of experience as a BI Analyst or Business Operations Manager, with a track record of designing and delivering impactful reporting solutions
Experience working in a SaaS business
Expert level in using Tableau to create dashboards and visualizations
Expert level Excel and SQL skills for data querying and manipulation
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and data modeling principles
Strong data optimization skills and experience working with large data sets
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality


Thank you for your interest in SS&C! To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at www.ssctech.com/careers.

Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

Title: Branch Banking Data Analyst
Description:
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

The Branch & Small Business Banking (BSBB) team is looking for a data analyst for a variety of new and impactful projects across the 2,300 branches and 12k bankers. Successful candidate will have a strong background with data engineering and ETL architecture and experience with Alteryx, leveraging multiple data sources (including database and API connections) is a requirement. Primary focus for the position will be development, implementation and maintenance of data and systems needed for new initiatives. Will be responsible for interactions with other data and technology teams across the organization.

Responsible for working on big data/analytics projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. Acquires data from multiple data sources in order to perform analysis. Identifies, analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex data in order to provide answers to business questions as well as provide recommendations for action. Interprets data and analyze results using various statistical techniques and tools. Presents data and analysis in a clear and concise manner allowing the audience to quickly understand the results and recommendations so they activate upon them and make data driven decisions. Collaborate with various partners to provide a holistic view of the analysis. Measures and monitors results of applied recommendations and present adjustments. Ensures all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards.

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent work experience
Five to seven years of statistical and/or data analytics experience



Preferred Skills/Experience


Experience with ETL tools such as Alteryx
Working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, SAS, SPSS, Geo-spatial tools and others to perform analysis and interpret data
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in analytics, advanced analytics/statistics, predictive modeling
Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Demonstrated project management skills
Effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills



If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

Benefits:

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):


Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)
Basic term and optional term life insurance
Short-term and long-term disability
Pregnancy disability and parental leave
401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan
Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)
Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities
Adoption assistance
Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law



EEO is the Law

U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal KNOW YOUR RIGHTS EEO poster.

E-Verify

U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program.

HTML:
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

The Branch & Small Business Banking (BSBB) team is looking for a data analyst for a variety of new and impactful projects across the 2,300 branches and 12k bankers. Successful candidate will have a strong background with data engineering and ETL architecture and experience with Alteryx, leveraging multiple data sources (including database and API connections) is a requirement. Primary focus for the position will be development, implementation and maintenance of data and systems needed for new initiatives. Will be responsible for interactions with other data and technology teams across the organization.

Responsible for working on big data/analytics projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. Acquires data from multiple data sources in order to perform analysis. Identifies, analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex data in order to provide answers to business questions as well as provide recommendations for action. Interprets data and analyze results using various statistical techniques and tools. Presents data and analysis in a clear and concise manner allowing the audience to quickly understand the results and recommendations so they activate upon them and make data driven decisions. Collaborate with various partners to provide a holistic view of the analysis. Measures and monitors results of applied recommendations and present adjustments. Ensures all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent work experience
  • Five to seven years of statistical and/or data analytics experience


Preferred Skills/Experience

  • Experience with ETL tools such as Alteryx
  • Working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, SAS, SPSS, Geo-spatial tools and others to perform analysis and interpret data
  • Experience with BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI
  • Experience in analytics, advanced analytics/statistics, predictive modeling
  • Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Demonstrated project management skills
  • Effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills


If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

Benefits:

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):

  • Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)
  • Basic term and optional term life insurance
  • Short-term and long-term disability
  • Pregnancy disability and parental leave
  • 401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan
  • Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)
  • Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities
  • Adoption assistance
  • Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law


EEO is the Law

We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Title: Quantitative Research Analyst
Description:
New Frontier Advisors LLC (NFA) is a research and investment advisory firm specializing in the development and application of leading-edge investment management technology. A small company with a growing global presence, NFA pioneered asset management as an ETF strategist.




NFA is an equal opportunity employer offering a creative work environment, a competitive package of employee benefits, and a chance to work with leading experts in the field of asset management.

Job Description

The successful candidate must be interested in a small company environment where they will be exposed to many aspects of the process, including investment research, portfolio management and implementation, investment operation, performance reporting, and investment education. They will work closely with accomplished investment professionals to support the institutional research, consulting, and asset management process. This role offers the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in portfolio management. This is an entry level position for someone with 1-3 years of experience.

Investment Research:

Conduct empirical financial and economic research using statistical and programming skills to enhance the investment process and propose actionable solutions for portfolio management
Contribute to consulting projects and white papers as needed

Portfolio Management and Implementation:

·      Conduct ETF due diligence, including identifying new opportunities and monitoring existing ETFs for potential replacement.

·      Utilize our patented asset allocation software

·      Participate in weekly investment committee meetings to review market trends and analyze emerging risks for portfolio management

Investment Operations:

Update investment strategies with new market information
Support operations around portfolio rebalancing
Manage daily account activities and trading
Propose tax transition analyses and manage tax trading for High-Net-Worth clients when needed
Assist with best execution practices and adhere to compliance-required procedures

Performance Reporting:

Handle investment performance data on a monthly basis
Document performance calculations and reporting procedures
Maintain and update performance databases.
Collaborate with the technology team to improve the process.

Investment Education:

Prepare and contribute to bi-weekly investment updates, quarterly commentaries, and webinars
Provide performance analysis and client-friendly presentations

Required Skills and Qualities

Strong quantitative abilities:
Programming experience implementing statistical techniques in Matlab, R, or Python
Familiarity with other scripting and programming languages
Proficiency with Excel and financial databases (e.g. Bloomberg)
Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills to produce high-quality, independent research
Genuine interest in finance and investment, with a drive to learn and grow in this field
Adaptability and willingness to take on diverse responsibilities in a dynamic environment
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, with a positive attitude and ability to work well with others
Attention to detail and proficiency in accurate documentation
Strong communication and writing skills:
Ability to explain complex quantitative concepts clearly
Capacity to understand financial and business contexts, adapting communication to different audiences
Education

B.A./B.S. or higher in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Financial Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science) from a top tier university.

Contact

Additional information can be found at www.newfrontieradvisors.com.
